description: I like Noah's bagels but it's not the best. Sometimes they make good bagels but sometimes they don't and there service can be bad and I think their coffee is pretty average.
author: Kapil J.

description:
I've tried this location several times in the past year. Every time, they make my food wrong, don't even know they have what I order on the menu, and it takes a really long time for them to make your order. 

They claim they make Peet's coffee drinks. The cashier told me they don't make iced vanilla lattes. When the sign right behind him states otherwise. The next guy says he can make it for me. I told him if you don't usually make it, (which is insane, if you have it on your menu), don't offer to make. I let him make it for me, and sure enough the iced vanilla latte didn't taste like vanilla or even sweet for that matter. It was just coffee over milk. 

I have ZERO faith in this establishment at this point. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY.
author: Carolina L.

description:
Today has been a bad day at Noah's bagels all together. The first noahs couldn't get their registers to work so didn't serve us. This one I'm writing a review at decided to stop serving everything about an hour and a half before closing (5pm).

First, they shared no egg sandwiches (main reason we went here). Second, no cold brew iced drinks - just drip coffee. Overall, huge disappointment and acted like we were an inconvenience to them, taking forever to wait on us.
author: Christopher S.

description:
Super disappointed in the total lack of customer
care at this Noah's. We walked in to get a late lunch and The guy Joaquin wouldn't put a little turkey in a bagel to make my son a sandwich and walked away from two dozen bagels I was going to order. No where does it say I'm only going to serve what I like to serve. 

Clearly he wanted to get out of there. Bummer. Won't go back again.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Just got to San Francisco for a birthday trip and figured I needed a quick bite to eat. Me and my friends go to Noah's and the menu looks great. 

The salmon smear should be on every bagel! It was so good on the Power Egg White. My only complaint is that both the egg and turkey sausage were so thin. If you're hungry, go for the double egg.
author: Brenda A.

description:
Never really manage to wait long enough
Always out of plain and sesame bagel
Poor service
Wondering how a bagel only place can be so inefficient ?
author: Alex D.

description: One of the toasters was not working so this slowed up production today.  Tomatoes are pink and lack taste, Noah can find better maybe organic tomatoes that would be great.  Hummus on whole grain good but thrown together sloppily. Quality control, guys.  Greek Yogurt parfait LOADED with sugar. Hard to go healthy here.
author: blaine s.

description: The only bagel and breakfast sandwich joint in the neighborhood. The chestnut street location always has a lot of homeless people hanging around in the morning - I would otherwise eat outside. The sandwiches are good but I feel like they microwave some of the eggs as they have a rubbery texture. They also don't toast the bagels enough- maybe they are in a rush? I would suggest they replace the avocado mush for sliced avocados but that's my two cents.
author: Lady N.

description:
Yummy! Soft fresh bagels!!  The employees are really nice. Fast service!
Highly recommend!!
author: Dawn G.

description: I think they are the smartest of the Noahs since they knew what to do with my coupon.  Unfortunately on sunday at 3 pm they do not do sandwiches.  Sad.  They had bagels, whatever is left.  They had pastries 4 for 6.00 and of course their coffees.
author: Helen L.

description: How about lock your door or indicate that you're closed before I walk in. I won't ever try to grab coffee here instead of Peet's again
author: Nathan L.

description:
Went here and ordered a simple Turkey Avocado Club sandwich. I then waited around for 20 minutes only to get a sandwich that had NO TURKEY and NO AVOCADO. It just had bacon and sauce (which I didn't want; I'd mentioned no sauce three times). I then had to haggle with the clueless manager for five minutes to get a refund. Any self-respecting establishment would've at least given me a free bagel or discount for next time for all the hassle. NEVER GOING HERE AGAIN!!! 

PS -- I get that people make mistakes. I was in the restaurant business myself. But it's how you rectify the mistake that counts!
author: J K.

description: Bagels are delish themselves. But be sure to ask for extra smear which they will charge you for. Without it they will barely even cover one half of your bagel so your left eating a plain dry bagel half.
author: Tayler W.

description:
Not sure why people have nothing great to say??? I was a little scared to try the Nova Lox, but it was so freaking fantastic! I had it on the Spinach Swiss bagel, it was so good. It comes with tomato, capers, lox, schmear, and cucumbers. I was so excited about it I bought a bakers dozen at $14.99 (comes with two schmear, and it's a little more for special bagels)! Can't wait to make a breakfast bagel in the morning. 

Con: do NOT use the bathroom. There was feces all over the toilet and it was extremely dirty.
author: Shannon F.

description:
I am actually perplexed how Noah's still has a business. I waited over an hour for a bagel with cream cheese. They "forgot" about three orders ahead of mine and when I got my bagel an hour and 15 minutes later, it wasn't the right order. 
They then proceeded to offer people "sweets" as an apology for not getting their orders. Absolutely pathetic. The employees were extremely rude and the manager Nicole was sitting in the back on her phone not helping the situation what so ever. 
We will no longer be using Noah's for anything business related as well. They can't seem to get that right either. All you have to do is make one single bagel .... why is that so hard?
author: Alli R.

description: I have never been so disappointed about a bagel as I was today at Noah's. I couldn't have had a More simple order and everything was wrong. I asked for toasted bagel with cream cheese... not only was my bagel cold but they didn't even have the decency to spread the cream cheese. Instead they put a tiny scoop of cream cheese in the middle of 1 side. Didn't spread it whatsoever nor put any on the other half. The bagel itself was subpar and the help was atrocious. I'd recommend finding any other bagel shop besides there. What a disappointment.
author: Katie S.

description: Very frustrating, asked for garden veggie spread, double checked with both the cashier and the employee delivering my bagel to make sure that it was correct, got home and it was garlic spread. Would have been 5/5 bagel otherwise.
author: Cheyenne O.

description:
Man. I hate blowing up businesses on Yelp because I'm such a positive person (you can tell by my reviews) but, what an ordeal Noah's Bagels was last Sunday (12/18). 

I was "greeted" by the guy at the register who refused to look up from his screen for a good  three minutes and just gave me a blank stare. Very strange interaction. I heard the woman before me say there weren't any onion bagels left but, wanted to confirm with the store employee and he replied with another blank stare. Undeterred, I ordered a bagel sandwich with lox and asked for it to be toasted. 

30 minutes later...

I kid you not, it took them 30 minutes to complete my order. For a bagel.  

Slightly frustrated (along with everyone else in the store), I returned home to find my garlic bagel untoasted. Arg. 

Look, I understand this is a first world problem but, management needs to know how inefficient their process is at this location. 

Booooo.
author: Benjamin F.

description: Website says open until 5:00. Sighn on door says open until 5:00. I get there at exactly 4:40. Guys in there was already cleaning up and wouldn't serve me.
author: Cecil C.

description: Barely had any bagels, employees don't care, completely forgot an item I ordered. "There are 3 bagels in there" nope, only two, "no there should be 3". Every person I saw order something had their order made wrong. Will not be returning to this location.
author: C M.

description: My initial rating was five stars, but lately my orders have been sloppily made and getting charged for extra avocado and they don't add it into my sandwich. I used to enjoy getting my breakfast and lunch here, but I think I'll give Noah's a break for now
author: Joy A.

description: We waited for 45 minutes for 2 toasted bagels and when we went up and asked how much longer they said "I don't know" so we asked for a refund and she didn't know how to put it back in the card so she just gave us a bunch of loose change. STAY FAR AWAY
author: mackenzie e.

description: Avoid avoid avoid. Took 20min to get one toasted bagel w cream cheese. Not much line. Staff looks confused. Bagel was ultimately not toasted which I found out after I left. Please don't go here so they fold and we get something of higher quality and commitment in this retail soace
author: Benjamin F.

description: They just started giving refunds because people were waiting for +45min for beagles with less than 30 customers
author: Alexander H.

description: Worst customer service! Always screws up my order and never cuts the bagel in half.  The woman behind the counter is very rude and has no idea what she's going!
author: Daniela R.

description:
The bagels here are solid, but that's about it. I've been a Noah's bagels fan my whole life, but the service at this Noah's is really pitiful. Time after time, I feel like I'm being mistreated as a customer when I come here. My most recent episode:
1) felt hurried to order. The attendant didn't make eye contact with me once or make me feel like a welcome Customer. 
2) asked for soy milk and was told that they don't do that, then told that they had no dairy alternates. If you are a business in SF serving coffee and modeling yourself as a coffee / bagel joint, this is absolutely necessary. 
3) asked for hot sauce and was told that they don't do that, and then told that they had no hot sauce other than ketchup. If you are a business in SF serving bagels and modeling yourself as a coffee / bagel joint, this is absolutely necessary. 
4) they were out of coffee at the machines. Had to wait a few minutes for the coffee to be switched. Of course this is normally totally fine, but on top of everything else, it was just too much. 
Highly recommend Coffee Roastery down the street.
author: Billy B.

description:
Oh Noah,
A first! My deconstructed sandwich was a delight. Cucumbers stacked 3 high, capers piled in one spot. Lox to the side-inside a bagel? Nailed the onion & tomato placement but all in all. Not your best work.
author: Paula Y.

description:
Not sure why this place has so many bad reviews because the chicken pesto with a cheddar jalapeño bagel I had was absolutely delicious. 
The people were not rude, but efficient. The back seating and patio were nice too. Overall a great first experience.
author: Ana C.

description: I spent 15 minutes in line waiting to order a coffee only to find out they were out. This place is the slowest had most disorganized coffee shop I've ever been in. If anyone is reading this who happens to be a restaurant consultant I recommend you approach this establishment and offer to help them improve their operation and processes because it's an absolute nightmare.
author: Al D.

description: This place is the worst. Dirty, gross and takes forever. We waited 45 minutes today for 2 plain bagels. And they were stale.
author: Brett B.

description: This place has the worst service.  They wait until you have already waited 15 minutes in line to tell you there's going to be a longer wait and then ask do you still want to order?  Yes I want to still f'ing order!  I've been waiting in this damn line for 15 min.  Rude and it ultimately took 45 min to get a simple bagel sandwich.
author: Rohini G.

description: Noah's is pretty good and their service is pretty quick if they aren't too busy. When I got here around 3:30 they were out of a bunch of different bagels so that was kind of disappointing-- if you want more selection and probably better service go early in the day (morning or maybe lunch)!
author: Anna V.

description:
Worst service!  STAY AWAY.  Waited 45 minutes for 3 toasted bagels and returned them because they were cold.  They ran out of coffee too!  Not sure how they stay in business.

Manager no where to be found.Contacted the manager to provide feedback - not impressed with her response or reaction.

.
author: Sybil P.

description:
To sum it up in one sentence, their bagels are alright and the service is mediocre. 

I live around the corner from here and I usually come on the weekends. The service is always extremely slow, it's definitely not a quick "bagel to-go", and the staff aren't the most friendly. 

Last time I went in the cashier rang up my order and then rang up my friend who got the same thing and it was a different price. When we asked about it he had wrong up the wrong water bottle and then got distracted by something else. When he turned his attention back on us he was confused why we were still standing there...because we hadn't actually paid yet. He had accidentally already cleared the order as if she had paid and had to start over again. We were not in a rush and totally understand these things happen sometimes but it was a little frustrating. 

I did give it 3 stars though because (most of the time) their bagels are very fresh and delicious! I recommend asking for double cream cheese though if you're just getting a plain bagel, toasted with shear because sometimes they're a little skimpy and it's dry. I also love the Santa Fe when you're in the mood for something a little more substantial for breakfast.
author: Chelsea M.

description: This place has bad reviews but I honestly don't understand why! I went on a Saturday morning and the place was moderately busy but the staff were super efficient and very respectful. The bagel sandwiches I ordered were delicious and ready within 5 minutes. They have the best bagels, cream cheese and orange juice! Will definitely be coming back next time I'm in San Fran!
author: Olivia C.

description: This is less a commentary on Noah's and more a commentary on the general quality of bagels on the west coast. Truly a mystery why good bagels don't exist out here but sadly that's the case. Noah's is not a bad spot for a quick breakfast sandwich but it's more of a compromise than a plan
author: David S.

description: Should be a decent place to get coffee and bagels but service is slow and food quality/sandwiches aren't great at all
author: Michael B.

description: Reeaaallly hit or miss. Sometimes the staff is awesome and makes the best breakfast sandwich and it's dope. And other times they're just alright and the bagel won't come out toasted and the cheese won't be melted. The few times that's happened though they've been slammed and it's tough keeping up.
author: Hayley G.

description: How it possible that this place is still open, given it takes 20+ minutes to make a toasted bagel. This is by far the most poorly managed cafe/restaurant in the neighborhood.
author: Matt D.

description: Store hours are unclear and they seem to close randomly. This has happens multiple times. They seem to change their staff constantly. I work in the neighborhood -- and I know the customers in the area a a pain... I can see why the staff quit. But a bit of better management on store hours please?
author: Karina O.

description: Be prepared to wait 15 mins for them to toast a bagel. Lots of staff but highly inefficient. Worst Noah's I've been to and won't return to this location
author: Cameron T.

description: I come to this Noah's all the time and it's usually awesome. Today however was a nightmare. Not sure if it's because Steve wasn't working or what (Steve rocks) but the employees were rude, they forgot half my order and when I finally got it there was barely any cream cheese on it. Waste of money
author: Madie H.

description: Just tried to go to Noah's to redeem my Groupon, and they apparently close early. Even though their business hours are posted to be open until 5pm. Pretty lame. If you're not going to stay open until 5 then change your hours.
author: Susan Z.

description: Extremely slow service with no sense of urgency. Out of stock on many items (by 10:30am!). Really regret coming here and waiting 40 minutes just for a bagel.
author: Christina Y.

description: Today I watched one of the Noah's people gingerly walk over to a troubled blind man, help him with his order (patiently read thru the menu for this man), go and check on price of what man wanted, and then help the man put on his coat and gather his belongings. I can't say I see a ton of acts of complete compassion and selfless kindness in the Marina- and this one was such an amazingly sweet, gentle, genuine, big-hearted act. Wow. Blown away. Also, good coffee- try the Chelsea.
author: Eliza B.

description: Awful place. Takes FOREVER EVERY TIME. Given the place multiple shots, fails every time. If you feel like waiting in line for 20 minutes, then another 20 while one person makes 10 pre-made sandwhiches, this is your place. I kid you not, 30-40 minutes every time. Sucks
author: Jimmy D.

description: I have ordered Noah's through postmates three times. Two of the three were incorrect, but my most recent experience was particularly bad. One of my six bagels was incorrect, which I could understand given that they run out of certain types. Not a huge deal. However, I ordered two schmears, plain and onion chive, and I got salmon and honey walnut. I do not eat salmon, so this is not an acceptable substitution, nor was I asked what kind of substitution I would like. I suspect it was carelessness and not that they were out of the ones I wanted. When I called the store to find out how to remedy the problem, the person on the phone was quite rude and suggested I come to the store to switch them out rather than sending someone with the correct order. I order Noah's because it's convenient, but after this I won't be back.
author: Leah L.

description: Picked up a baker's box for breakfast one Sunday morning. The staff was patient with me as I hesitantly made my selection. The pre-sliced all the bagels and we toasted them ourselves at the house. Being from NY, I can definitely vouch that these are pretty up there among some of the best bagels I've tried. My favorite part was how light and fluffy their cream cheese it. A must try if you're in the area.
author: T. Renee D.

description:
Cinnamon sugar bagel...I loved you the first time I laid lips on you. 

But now we must go our separate ways. 

This is the hardest breakup I've ever had to deal with. 

Yours truly- 
Court
author: Court S.

description: It's not too busy for a Saturday yet we stand at the register where it says "Order here." After about 5 minutes, the lady calls us to order at the "Pick Up" window, but she takes this lady's order who just walks up to her. I'm sorry, I'm not about to wait for a 3 bagel and sandwich order ahead of me when I had clearly been waiting where we should have ordered. I took my business elsewhere. No sense of respect for others.
author: Juan G.

description: The bagles are good but the service is so awful that I won't be coming back. I have been on several occasions, and they are consistently awful. Waited 30 minutes for a bagel today because they messed up everyones orders. They didn't have names attached to the orders so they were just laying bagels out on the counter for people to go through and figure out if it was their order. Hire better staff and actually train them.
author: Kimberly W.

description: My husband and I ordered a bacon/cheese and a spinach bagel.  They were delicious and very soft.  I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a quick breakfast bite.
author: Colleen M.

description: Ah Noah's on chestnut!! I was rooting for you despite the odds! How do you mess up an order of six bagels? I ordered three 9-grains and three asiagos and happens you put only one 9-grains and two regular wheat :( :(
author: Chanel H.

description:
Not sure how you can screw up something simple like bagels and cream cheese, but apparently it's possible, along with having service be as slow as molasses.

I came on a Saturday morning at 9 am and the Marina was already bustling with the usual Lululemon-clad crowd, needing coffee and nourishment after an early workout. The line was really long, and I don't know why they need to take your order twice: once to punch your order and then you wait another 5-10 min so someone can verify your order and have you pay. Seems inefficient to me, and the person taking the order the first time got it all wrong, so that was a useless step.

I don't know how hard it is to put an order in for a Thintastic bagel, lox, and cream cheese on the side - it's only 3 things. After I placed my order with the first person, the second person confirmed that I had ordered a Thinastic bagel with salmon cream cheese: wrong. After I corrected the order, I thought I was good to go.

When I opened up my bagel, I had about 1/4 of cream cheese slathered on the bagel, not on the side. I ended up scraping most of it out, and it wasn't the worst thing in the world, but it was just annoying that this 10 minute order, and having to deal with so many people who couldn't get this simple thing right, was frustrating.

I'll be taking my business elsewhere - slow service, nothing special-tasting, and $6 for a mediocre bagel, cream cheese, and lox sandwich - no thanks.
author: Christina L.

description:
Baked goods stale. Run out of normal flavor bagels quickly 
Customer service not friendly.
author: Claire V.

description: You can work here with a cup of coffee & they have an outside patio & backroom. Great private office away from home.
author: Janet G.

description: Terrible customer service and they get the order wrong every single time. Bagels are great so this review probably will not mean much to the customer as they are always busy but heir manager should know how unpleasant it is to go in there 3 times a week.
author: Jessica S.

description: This Noah's is okay. Ordered the Nova Lox. My sandwich was made okay. You know how just some places take more care in the way they make there sandwich's than others? Well I've had better Noah's sandwich before. Noah's has actually gone down hill since I first went to it. The coffee is good. It is hot and fresh. The coffee area needs to be maintained. It is a mess and coffee is all over the drip drains. Not sure if people are pouring it there or what. Also the packets of sugar are everywhere. They are not neatly in the container. I sat outside. This is a nice small seating area. Two tables are here. I thought I may have to sit inside because while I was waiting for my bagel there was no available table outside. If so I would have had to ask them to clean the table. It was dirty so glad I didn't have to. I always like to give Noah's second chances so I may try a bagel here again. Definitely don't have a problem with there coffee. It is good!
author: Angela M.

description: worst customer service ever!!!!! the fat lady at the cashier is the rudest worker i've ever encountered at a noahs. please fire her and replace with another nicer person who has the basic manners to serve customers. she is the fat lady who works at the cashier at 9:30am on Tuesdays. please replace her if you want anymore customers. NEVER coming back here again.
author: Jane H.

description: If I could give this place zero stars I would. The bacon and egg bagel was passable at best but the pumpernickel with turkey and veggie cream cheese can only be described as slimy. Next to no cream cheese and a greasy residue forced me to throw away after two bites. This place sincerely insulted the New York style bagel and charges a hefty price for doing so.
author: Liz H.

description: One of the cashiers is pretty friendly but most of the staff is rude. The wait time for a bagel here is ridiculous, especially when there was only one person who ordered before me. The bagel wasn't anything special and my order was incorrect. I would not revisit this establishment.
author: Alexandria B.

description: Bagels--- never toasted!! 3 different occasions! Horrible coffee. Angry employees. Two stars for clean store and location.
author: Linda J.

description:
This is one of those times I should have checked the yelp reviews before deciding trying it out. I came here post-workout and was lured by the pictures on the menu into ordering the pepperoni pizza bagel. Wow-what a mistake! 
The bagel was literally SWIMMING in grease and just the sight of it made my stomach churn. It literally looked like something that had been regurgitated in a highschool cafeteria. No joke. 
I walked all the way back (to return said nasty food) and the manager literally just shrugged and handed me cash back. No apology; no explanation- Nothing. 
So yeah, my advice is to skip this place and head across the street to Le Marais.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Got a simple bagel with cream cheese and bacon...and there was barely any cream cheese. Loved the bagel (spinach and Swiss) but there ain't nobody who wants to eat that stuff dry. A sad breakfast. Don't be stingy...give the people what they want :D
author: Nicole S.

description:
This place seems to get slammed all of a sudden very often.  And I feel bad for the one person who is trying to take the order, make bagel sandwiches, charge the order, and move onto the next group of hungry customers.  

I wanted to try a blueberry smoothie, but her coworker who makes smoothies was in the back.  Probably baking bagels.  So I just got the premade yogurt parfait, which really wasn't a problem.  My husband didn't like his bagel sandwich too much.  But do I blame him?  We are former New Yorkers, after all.   Hell, I don't even blame Noah's Bagels- no access to NY water.  

Secret: the bathroom is way in the back, outside the restaurant, and in a separate building by the back garden.  Shh...
author: Miran C.

description: Stopped by here for a quick breakfast on the way to Presidio. Service was great, bagels were delicious. Can't complain.
author: Hung L.

description: I'm giving this place 3 stars based on the staff. I arrived around 2pm while I was waiting for someone to finish at a meeting nearby. I saw they had. Bottomless coffee for done in customers, so this was perfect for my wait. I just wanted  a medium brew coffee, no flavors, no fluff, just caffeine. I go to the self service coffee bar and begin to pour my "uptown" brew and can only get a dribble. I look at my other choices and There were dark roast no flavor coffee, medium roast vanilla hazelnut, and a medium roast decaf. I notified the staff and they said they could make a new pot, great!, right? So she kindly fills my cup from the brewing coffee system and hands it to me, however there are tons of coffee grinds in it. I bring it back to her and she give me a new cup, YAY, I thank her and sit down to enjoy my garlic bagel with garden vegetable schmeer, and it was fantastic. They were out of most bagels, so if you are picky, get there early. My biggest complaint is that they never did put out the freshly brewed coffee, so for every cup I wanted to refill, I had to ask them to do it, which wouldn't be a problem if they weren't so focused on their closing duties. By The recycling bins were covered with paper bags when I arrived at 2, we could only throw our trash into one garbage can. I asked what time they close and was told they were "typically out by 5" another customer asked the same question, so it wasn't just me that noticed the closing duties being done so early. I also noted that the dark roast was empty a few minutes after the medium roast and that was not put back out either, even though they still had 3 hours til close.
author: A L.

description: I stopped in for lunch today and had a delicious ruben sandwich on marble rye. Outstanding! So yummy! The coleslaw was fresh and delicious with Noah's signature faint horseradish flavor. Service was excellent and I will most certainly return the next time I am on Chestnut Street at lunch time.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
Hungover on a Saturday afternoon, I popped in here to grab a quick bite on the way to the bus stop.  Well, I thought it would be quick.

I waited in line behind some lady with two annoying kids that she didn't care to control.  One was playing a harmonica loudly while her mom asked 20 questions to the girl behind the counter.  I don't even know what she ordered, but it sounded like her order wasn't even that big.

When she was done ordering, the girl behind the counter left and pointed me to the other cashier, who was now taking someone else's order that came in the store after me.

I finally placed my order for a bagel and cream cheese and had to wait through them making mom's bigger order, and the guy who came in after me.

The bagel I finally received was on the smaller side, was more microwaved than toasted.  At least the sundried tomato cream cheese was good.
author: Rob P.

description: Noah's makes the opposite of New York Style bagels.  I generally think of a New York style bagel as somewhat dense and chewy.  These bagels are light, airy, and tender (not in a good way).  The service was friendly and pretty efficient.  I ordered a bagel sandwich (egg, cheese, bacon, whole wheat bagel).  It was made fresh, with fresh ingredients.  It tasted very bland.  No seasoning.  The bagel was simply okay.  I've been to one other Noah's bagels so I wanted to give this chain another try.  Now I understand why I don't get my weekly breakfast sandwich from there.  Don't get me wrong, there was nothing bad about the experience, but there is also no wow factor for sure.
author: Paul W.

description: Rude workers here. I asked for just a little cream cheese on my bagel, they put a huge clump. They even asked me to chase down someone who didn't pay for there food. Will not be going back here.
author: Joe C.

description: Ordered a great delicious latte and share breakfast with my hubby. Pretty good good bagels if you love bagels I would recommend this place!!
author: Lynette J.

description: Please don't go if time is a factor! We spent a half hour ordering two prepared bagels. The Staff is slow, gruff, and misprounced every customers' name. If you adhere to the old expression "time is blood" then stay away for your own good.
author: Kym Q.

description: Yummy experience. Nothing much considering it's a chain, but the bagel was good & I cannot complain. The amount of choices & varieties they have is probably the best part. Good service, fast, and fulfilling!
author: Alena G.

description: So you send me an offer to try your new shmears, but you don't have any bagels in stock...odd on a Sunday at almost noon.  The only palatable bagel to pair was onion or garlic, but my 3 year old wasn't a fan.  How do you have no plain, egg, sesame, poppy, Asiago???  I worked at Noah's for 5 1/2 years in high school and college in a myriad of roles...even baking for a summer.  Never did I let that happen under my watch unless the oven was broken.   All I got from the girl was a "we're out of a lot of things...sorry."  Left without anything.   Things have truly gone downhill, especially at this store.  Realizing my frustration, a manager should have said something to me...or at least that is what I did when I worked there...
author: Jenny T.

description: I am not sure why this place gets such a bad reviews. I am so far been treated kindly and been given 0 attitude from the staff. Their bagels been consistent and they do what I'd asked. Oh....right I actually used "please", "Thank you", " No rush" and "I will pay extra if I can add this or that". As long as you don't give people grieves and demand the impossible. Perhaps they will treat you with kindness back. I gets the sense that most people that comes here in this area are a bunch of "I this and I that"  I gets my bagel the same and every time is the same. Lightly toasted and light on cream cheese. Never once they got it wrong. So I am giving them 5 stars.
author: S F.

description: Beyond done with this location.  This location definetly has its problems but today was the final straw. I watched an employee crack 6 raw eggs on a grill with gloves on and then proceeded to grab a bagel to cut without changing her gloves. When I found out it was my bagel she was making I politely asked her if she would mind changing her gloves since I was 7 months pregnant and did not want to risk being exposed to the raw eggs on her hand. She thought I wanted a different bagel so put the bagel back and asked me which flavor I wanted instead. I explained to her again that she had just handled the raw eggs without changing gloves so I wanted her to change gloves before making my bagel. She said ok and then grabbed the same bagel and started making it again without changing gloves. I tried to clarify again and then decided to cut my losses and walk out. Clerk at the cash register was clueless too. It's not worth $2.85 to risk getting salmonella because the employees ignore basic food safety.
author: Katie D.

description: It was ok when it was not busy. I came again today ordered my plain bagel and I had to wait for soooo long to get it?! And I asked it to be heated not toasted. Guess what? They just toasted it for me  plus it wasn't that busy.
author: Cass Z.

description: Came in here to place a catering order for our after-wedding brunch. The manager Joan was so nice and so helpful. Thanks!!
author: Katie M.

description: Very disorganized. Takes 10-15 minutes for three people to toast a bagel. They seem to be running back and forth making the food and running the register. They should take shifts making the food or taking orders so that the flow is smoother. The food isn't bad but this is a very simple menu it shouldn't take so long.
author: Zach H.

description: I've been vegan for over a year and have eaten at several other Noah's bagels. Went in and asked if a particular bagel was vegan. The woman working told me they didn't carry ANY vegan bagels. Knowing that this was incorrect I stepped outside and looked up online that all but a few of their bagels are in fact vegan. Returned to the store and told the woman this fact. She proceed to be rude, disrespectful, and messed up our order. I'm so very disappointed. If I could give less than 1 star I would.
author: M S.

description:
If you've ever dropped out, been kicked out, or struck out of anything at any time in your life do not despair, you are Noah's material.  

My bad experiences here number in the bakers dozens.  The only thing "New York" about this place is the title and the surly service.  The bagels are downright pathetic.

The only reason to walk by this place is to give it the finger.  Otherwise, stay clear.
author: Mr. Papshmir ..

description:
The 94123 Breakfast Sandwich Review #1


Is there anything more American than crushing a Sausage Egg and Cheese on a Saturday morning? Maybe flying a bald eagle during the Fleet Week Air Show, crushing a bud-heavy, and singing "Party in the USA" while wearing your 'star spangled and hammered' frat mason tank top...just maybe.

There is nothing I crave more on a weekend morning in the 94123 than a delicious Sausage Egg and cheese sandwich. So I figured why not review all of them within my non-uberX and non-dirty 30 walking distance bubble from my apartment? It is the least I can do as a "K" parking sticker displaying patriot of the neighborhood.

Noah's Bagels: Everyone at one point has walked into Noah's and been overwhelmed by the massive bagel selection. Seems like there is everything from wheat, to jalapeño cheddar, to butter-beer bagels that you can choose to put your breakfast sandwich between. In the past, I have tried the "Sante Fe Bagel Sandwich" which includes a sausage patty, santé fe sauce, and pepper jack cheese. What it does not include is a packet of "tums". If you are not like me and can handle a fire bomb to the gut at 9am, then I recommend the santé fe sandwich all the way. It gives you a kick of spice while also including the three main food groups: Sausage, Cheese, and heartburn.

If you are like me and want something that will not keep you out of commission for the next six hours I recommend the Egg White "thintastic" Sandwich with turkey Sausage. It was fairly light on the grease and isn't quite the gut bomb since you get the egg whites. The only interesting thing was that half of my sandwich had cream cheese on it too? Maybe it was a mistake, or maybe they don't like Redheads. Either way, it was a decent sandwich and I give the sandwich itself 4 stars. The rest of the Noah's experience brought down the review to 3 stars due to the fact that there were a large amount of sticky kids that were in Noah's at the same time as my girlfriend and I. They also messed up her coffee, and if you mess up her order, well then, that is going to cost you a star.

Until next time Noah's!
author: Matt E.

description:
I walked in and asked if they have a tofu cream cheese. There were 2 people looking pretty busy handling food to customers. A tall woman with a very bad skin looked at me with disgust and said "No" in a way like i offended her. Just no, no sorry no nothing. And walked away. 
That's some attitude. I wanted to get coffee but now for sure I wont be backc
author: Anastasia K.

description:
Below average bagels...  Processed, definitely not boiled and baked on premises.  They DON'T have egg salad?  And you say you're a bagel place?  hmmmm...
Good service though.
author: Nicole K.

description:
The Egg Mit Sandwich. I used to live in Laurel Heights and would pop in on weekend mornings for this bacon, cheddar, chive delight. I wanted a late lunch/early dinner while in the marina last week, so I decided to grab something quick- a Tuscan Pesto bagel sandwich it was.

Not the friendliest service- granted, I came in at 4:30 and they close at 5- but I got my sandwich, sat down with a self-serve water, ate the delicious and seemingly greasy bagel sandwich goodness and was on my way. Consistent. Just as good as I remembered in Laurel Heights.
author: Kristin F.

description:
On the plus side, they have a decent outside patio in the back and you don't have to pay much in terms of food in order to enjoy it.

Otherwise, this is just another Noah's bagel shop.  There's nothing terribly bad or good about this place.  Service was ok but I gave it a little less because my sandwich was really just warmed rather than toasted.  They also overdid the scallions in my lox/cheese/egg bagel.  

In a pinch, it's a place to stop to get a quick,cheaper bite to eat in the Marina while enjoying the sun in the back.  Otherwise, there are better options on Chestnut from a food perspective.
author: Ron E.

description: Amazing selection of bagels, six cheese bagel was amazing. Staff was very helpful. Great bagel shop
author: Ashlee B.

description:
Stopped in here for breakfast before heading out into SFO for the day and had a delicious egg white and turkey sausage bagel thin sandwich. 

Service was fast and efficient. The staff was super friendly. 

Coffee was tasty, and inexpensive. $2.50 for a large coffee (starbucks equivalent: VENTI). 

Conveniently located to our hotel on Lombard. 

Would definitely come back again next time I'm in town!
author: Conor U.

description:
Don't let their association with NY fool you!  I ordered a egg and cheese on a a plain bagel, my favorite combo from Daniel's bagel in NYC.  By comparison, this is awful.  Spongey bread, no flavor, no ketchup and pepper by default.  

Oh and the price - $4.59.  Daniel's charge $3.50 if I remember correctly.

Meh...
author: Bartek R.

description: I've gone here several times over the past few years and though they are often busy, they're always friendly and get my orders correct.  What can I say?  Good-quality friendly neighborhood cafe & breakfast place.  Simple and good!
author: Jordan M.

description:
The ability to read is clearly not a requirement to work here. I eat here often because I like the food, but I believe they've only gotten my order correct once. They meticulously take my order and I see it go into the computer properly, but what you get is always a mystery. "No cheddar cheese, substitute swiss cheese", means just that, but not to these yahoos. It's just random letters that mean nothing. "Double toasted"? Bagel sandwich maker: "What? I'll ignore that shit."

The moral of the story is this. Be prepared for them to royally screw up your order, and always check it after you get it. Then return it back to them to redo. Usually (I said usually) they get it right the second time... except for "double toasted", that might as well be written in Chinese.
author: Dave L.

description: I purchased a coffee and a panini. It was hot, quick and easy but nothing special. Gets the job done.
author: Brandon V.

description: I really don't know why this place has only 2.5 stars. I come here every week and grab my usual, toasted asiago bagel with butter. It's cheap, fast, and utterly delicious. Service is fast, and I've always found the workers to be extremely friendly. They recognise me, and whenever they see me walk in, the actually greet me by name (gasp!) a service I don't get in most places. Yes, the service can be a little slow at times, buts that's only when they're trying to keep up with the rush of rich, lulu lemon wearing, screaming baby toting gals who come in here and harass them because for some reason they think they're above the people who work here. So, if you want a good, cheap bagel and a friendly smile, go to Noah's.
author: Rebekah H.

description:
WOULD NOT GO BACK IF IT WAS THE HAPPIEST PLACE ON EARTH!!!

I MUST BE AN IDIOT TO CONTINUE TO STICK UP FOR THIS PLACE...BUT ADD ME TO THE LONG LIST OF DISSATISFIED CUSTOMERS THAT NOAH'S HAS FINALLY LOST FOREVER. 

SCENARIO: I ordered two soups, but when I got home I realized that both were only half full? Serious party foul (see photo).

So I called and spoke to the manager, he apologized and he said I could come back and get new ones. At this point I assume they're at least "trying" to make up for the mistake and keep customer service alive. (yeah right).

QUESTION: So how come when I get to Noah's, I am ignored?? I see my new order of soups sitting on the counter just waiting to get picked up. Finally the girl who originally filed my order sees me and says, "Ahh you came back"... Yes, you're damn right I did. Then she tries to explain that they were out of the smaller lids so she put it in a bigger bowl but only filled it halfway to compensate however they were supposedly the same portion (which I measured afterwards and it's not).

WELL THEN YOU SHOULDVE TOLD ME THAT INSTEAD OF HAVING ME WALK 6 BLOCKS TO FIND MY SOUP HALF EMPTY AND THEN HAVE TO WALK ALL THE WAY BACK TO PICK UP MY NEW ONE (I said to myself). 

She walked to the soup, filled up some cups for other customers, and proceeded to fill other orders. Um, hello, so does that mean I'm no longer entitled to my soup since you just walked away from me and have gone back to ignoring me? And IF they were out of the smaller lids, how the heck do you explain why you have smaller lids available now (10 minutes later)?? Did you just receive a delivery from the BS fairy? 

AND I CHECKED/MEASURED TO SEE IF HALF OF THE BOWL IS EQUAL TO A FULL CUP OF SOUP... IT'S NOT!!!!!

SO NEXT TIME YOU TRY TO BS SOMEONE, KNOW WHAT YOU'RE TALKING ABOUT... GOOD-BYE NOAH'S.
author: Joraine C.

description: I ordered a bacon, egg, cheddar bagel. It was good until I found A LONG BLACK HAIR IN IT. Absolutely disgusting, totally killed my appetite; don't waste your time or your money here. I will never go back.
author: Amy G.

description:
Dear Noah's Bagels,

Why are you still in business? Your breakfast sandwich is sorry and so I am for your customers. Please do not serve us bad breakfast sandwiches.

Sincerely,
Jc
author: J C.

description: This store decided not to take take out orders anymore.  The service is poor in the store.  The staff is not well trained and consistently mess up orders.  Come on Noah's...get it together
author: Jeff S.

description: Had to dump out my latte after two sips and the bagels were horribly chewy, with unevenly spread cream cheese. Also, "toasted."
author: Niree N.

description:
Noah's bagels are as expected. But service at this location gets 1 star, if that. Despite four employees supposedly working behind the counter, I stood waiting patiently at first, then decidedly impatiently as it became clear the employees would rather do anything than wait on me. Maybe because I was in the protected age category (over 40)?

 A woman walked in after me and interrupted their 4-way discussion to ask for a glass of hot water. One kid tripped over himself getting it for her. Serve a nonpaying customer before a customer with cash in her hand? Obviously no manager was on duty. At least I hope none of those brainless teens was a manager. 

When they finally got around to making eye contact with me, I was ready to walk out but I didn't have time to get in line elsewhere and I needed a bagel! So he bagged up my two bagels, but the server who had been using the cash register walked away (somewhere safe in the back room). According to the blank looks on the remaining employees, I had to assume they could not ring me up until the first kid closed the cash register. No explanation was given for why they could not ring me up on the cash register sitting next to the unusable one. 

I paid cash for the two lousy bagels sans tip, which is out of character for me because I'm generally a good tipper. Think I'll find my bagels elsewhere, Noah.
author: Daisy M.

description:
**Update**

Just want to let everyone know that Noah's still sucks and I hate their bagels and service equally
author: Michael N.

description: Don't understand the horrible reviews here (either the locals in the area are big complainers/divas/drama queens which could be the case or the service is consistently bad?). My boyfriend and I stopped in for a bagel on a weekend afternoon. We experienced fast, friendly service. We sat on the bench right out front to enjoy and people watch. It's not stellar, but definitely A-OK (however I haven't run into the rude manager/employees that others have cited).
author: Siv L.

description: Great value for money :) excellent healthy bagels :) New York nostalgic will find a nice New York Style bagels place in SFO :)
author: Barbara A.

description: I am a Noah's Bagels fan -- or rather, a very specific fan of their egg, cheddar, and bacon sandwich on a challah role with all the fixins.  This is my go-to order, and this location didn't disappoint.  To be fair, I haven't tried any of their traditional bagels, but again -- the breakfast sandwich on a challah role is the winner in my book.
author: Mel G.

description:
Two stars is mainly for the option of small outdoor seating in the back, nice enough staff, and a clean appearance.  The food (a big part of any dining establishment) is what brought this review down significantly.  

I ordered an everything bagel with cream cheese- and I'd rate that a one star.

Noah's has other menu options and maybe I should have gone with a regular breakfast sandwich NOT on a bagel, but at a place that is called/used to be called 'Noah's New York Bagels' you assume they do a bagel well enough.

My bagel was rubbery and stale.  The fennel seeds were the only overwhelming taste of the "everything." At least in NY an everything bagel includes garlic.  The cream cheese was thick, bland, and barely spreadable.  Unfortunately I don't know that freshness is top priority here.

I'm a NYC transplant so granted my bagel expectations may be higher than some, but I've had better bagels from the freezer isle in the grocery store. 

Please tell me there are better bagels in SF.
author: Miss W.

description: Worst place to go in the marina (or SF in general) for bagels. I've lived here for years and have given this place too many chances. Overpriced and constantly mess up orders. It's hard to mess up a bagel but these guys have found ways to do it. Save your money and go down the street. One of those situations where zero stars would have been too many!
author: Faiz H.

description: Several things wrong with his place. Let's start with the HORRIBLE service. This location specifically has terrible service when compared to other Noahs. The line is disorganized, the ordering process makes zero sense, they are frequently out of bagels, and I often feel as though I am walking into a vortex of pure anarchy when I decide to get a Sunday bagel. I hate to say it but the employees just don't seem to be the sharpest tools in the shed. I would feel guilty saying that but they're often not even friendly. Second, let me clarify that Noah's is not BAGELS. It's circular bread. It should be called Noah's Enriched Bread. Deeply enriched soft roll-into-a-ball bread. There is no crispy outside and sometimes they even seem like dough. Alas, I continue to go because this is the only place that serves anything remotely close to a bagel within a .5 mile radius of me. Buyer beware.
author: Ashley S.

description: Quick service, staff is always friendly and helpful, good prices compared to other places in the city. I like the toasted bagels with cream cheese or egg & cheese. The vanilla hazelnut coffee is my favorite.
author: Richelle M.

description: This location was just so incredibly convenient, I couldn't help but stop in often for breakfast. They greet you, they remember your name, they smile and make conversation with you - at least the older ladies behind the counter do. I have a picky request to have the bagel warmed up instead of toasted, because I like to tear it apart as if I were actually in New York & dip into cream cheese & they manage to get this request every time. Regardless of their long lines in the morning, they manage to whip those bagels out fast & efficiently!
author: Jules F.

description:
Took way too long
Long line

average bagels.

i mean bagels are pretty average. in this case the service matters and it sucked.
author: Fatte N.

description: I stopped in around 11am and there was no wait. I ordered one of their new low card egg white bagel sandwiches and a large coffee for $7. When I opened up the sandwich the egg was massive and the cheese melted so much that the bagel because soggy. I scarfed it down as fast as I could. i probably won't order an egg sandwich again since it was so messy and the bagel was getting soggy. But i love their Chelsea coffee.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
I've been in here three times.  Once during off peak hours, we were able to get our order, sit down and eat.  Basic stuff, nothing screwed up or bad, per se. 

They were oddly vacant the other day, and I got a HUGE breakfast 'wrap' (Santa Fe).  It was pretty spicy but not bad, and a lot of food for under six bucks.  It's not eggs benedict prepared poolside by a top chef at a four star Zagat hotel, but preferable to drive-through fast food.
author: Bill S.

description:
Okay, their bagels are good. Their pastries are good. Their new egg white bagel thin sandwiches are great.

But this place is just not well run. It takes way longer than it seems like it should and is pretty disorganized. Plus, some of the menu items are REALLY pricey for what they are.

Bottom line, some of their stuff is decent, but the service the times I've been is far from great. I don't know what is going on, but I'd much rather frequent a more intimate bagel shop that seems to take customer concerns more seriously.
author: Courtney A.

description: Please fire the rude manager . I believe her name was Christine . She was soo mean to her employees and to myself .
author: Zac R.

description:
I like Noah's bagels. 

But, I love love love sesame seeds. Yes, its true. You know those sesame bars that are all sesame seeds mixed with honey and then dried or baked or something. I found giant bars like this at a Walgreens in Miami last week. No kidding they were giant - like 3x6 inches...for $1.09 - forget about it. Seriously. I bought 5 of them and ate them within like 3 days. Incredible!

Oh yeah, Noah's has sesame bagels and with eggs and cheese and tomato and lots of pepper. This is a great start to my day. Coffee and bottled water too.
author: J T.

description:
Ever watch When Harry Met Sally?  Remember the part in the beginning where she goes to the diner with Harry and requests all these different options for her salad and apple pie?

I walked into Noah's with my friend, who was visiting from Boston.  We were looking for a quick bite to eat, preferably outside, since we had my dog with me.  We took turns going into Noah's to order, and I decided that what I really wanted was to be moderately healthy, so I decided on a breakfast sandwich.

The breakfast category had sandwiches, paninis and wraps.  I wanted the Swiss, Spinach and Mushroom sandwich ($4.65), but I could already tell that the ingredients would probably squish out from between the bread, so I told her I wanted it in the whole wheat wrap instead.  The following language-barrier-riddled conversation ensued:

Cashier: Ok, your total is $6.87.
Me: What??  The sandwich is only $4.65, plus tax it can't be that amount.
C: Veggie wrap $5.95.
M: Where does it say on the menu that it's $5.95?  Clearly it says $4.65 *points to menu*
C: No, you ordered veggie wrap.
M: No, I wanted the SANDWICH but in a wrap.
C: No no there are panini.
M: Okay, look.  I want THAT ONE.  $4.65.  In a wrap instead of on bread.
C: Yeah so you order veggie wrap.  $5.95.
M: Forget it.

The difference was really like a dollar, so I let it go, but it's the principle behind it.  Sorry Asian woman, there goes the dollar in your tip jar.

When my wrap came, it was insanely hot and I couldn't eat it right away.  It was filled with egg, tomatoes, a bit of spinach and potatoes.  Not entirely exciting, but not bad either.  It would've been better WITH MUSHROOMS AND SWISS CHEESE, but whatever.

Pass.
author: Tori S.

description: I love all these different type of bagels and cream cheese that they have. Good bagels.
author: Jonh S.

description: As a tourist this place is way to intense!  The locals get pissed off because you are looking at the menu too long. You cannot get a seat if you have more than just you and your dog in your party. I ordered the spinach, egg and mushroom sandwich on an asiago bagel, it was fresh but had zero taste!! Typical high strung San Franciso deli/bagel shop I thought.  The workers were friendly though so I gave it 3 stars because of that otherwise it would get a 2 star review from me.
author: Spry A.

description:
Seriously... its a frickin' bagel... how can you screw that up?

Trust me: they will find a way. This place has just gone down down down hill with the staff for the last number of years. At least now they smile, which is better than the last "crew" about 6 months back... but its amazing to me how often the bagel is jacked? Some times its not supposed to be sliced: it is. Sometimes not toasted: it is. Sometimes toasted: its not. Dont get me started on what type of cream choose to use...They really just do the opposite of what you like? 

Classic- last week the team from the suburbs seem to appear for the day -- they were like the all bagel all stars, clean cut, smiling, practically dancing on rainbows... they were like a bad disney land commericial, but damn it... they got my order right. This week, the normal crew, the normal screw ups... So sad. Seriously... its a frickin' bagel... how can you screw that up?

In our home it has become comical and we literally make bets on how many of the bagels we order will be screwed up: over under = 50%.
author: Lawrence T.

description: I love me some Noah's Bagels but this location is for the birds.  The floor layout  is silly and leads to horrible customer flow, the workers are rude and clearly hate their jobs, and the 82.3% of orders are incorrect.  It's science.
author: Joel M.

description: The bagels here are delicious. And well priced. And you know what, they do and ok job at toasting them or whatever, but holy lord the service here is despicable. The workers are lazy. So lazy. I will be waiting in line and workers will be sitting around doing nothing for so long before anyone helps me. They act as of I am doing them a disservice by being there. I went there every day for a few months because I work closeby and they we're rude every time. They don't pay attention to what they're doing either. I was once charged and extra 20$ for something an employee was buying and forgot to separate the tabs and then had to go back and have it refunded. And after they refunded it I had to check back in a few days later because they did it wrong . The whole staff needs to be fired because they do nothing positive for the business. I am very displeased and make it clear to everyone who may consider going there what they're in for. They have good bagels and they could have had a good regular customer.
author: Madi N.

description: It is what it is.  If you want consistent bagels, then this is your place.  My experience was terrible because of the service.  There was one other person in the store, and it still took 12 minutes to get in and out.  The kicker: all I wanted was a cup of black coffee.  The staff was busy talking to each other while I stood in line with the only other customer.  Once I finally paid and got my coffee cup, all of the coffee was out.  Now I had to wait longer while they brewed more.  I didn't even get a simple apology.  They just told me "it would be a few minutes."  The sad part: I like Noah's Bagels.  Just not this location.
author: Joe S.

description: Meh. The bagels are decent and the menu is just OK. I got the lox and scallions and was rewarded with a slab of salmon no bigger then a couple credit cards under a hunk of warm eggs and an especially average bagel. I can give this place credit for decent prices (the sandwich was under 5 bucks). Also, the thin bagels and egg whites should do well in the Marina. Overall, there are too many good places within a few blocks to merit any regular visits
author: Taylor C.

description: Slow and inefficient service. My bagel was ready before the cashier allowed me to pay, and she told me the wrong amount when running my credit card. The staff appears lifeless. Depressing and slow experience.
author: Captain B.

description: I like how it only says Noah's Bagels on this entry but when you walk by it clearly states NOAH'S NEW YORK BAGELS ... what makes them NY bagels? Nothing. Zip Zero. This is like when you go to the grocery store and they have "bagels" but in reality they are just round bread with a hole in the middle. Thats what these bagels are. Let me repeat ROUND BREAD WITH HOLES IN THE MIDDLE.
author: douglas B.

description: If you are visiting or new to the area, please don't think that Noah's Bagels are representative of bagels in SF...these bagels suck.
author: Alotta V.

description: Last Saturday was my last time buying anything from this place. I've been coming here for the last 2 years and I think they've gotten my order right maybe 3x. I order the same thing almost every time I come. Cinnamon raisin bagel double toasted with low fat cream cheese , easy.  On Saturday they had about 15 managers working so I said good my order should be right . Right after I ordered before I even payed my bagel was ready I paid and left. As I'm walking back to work I open my bagel and there it was a bagel that looked like it came right out the basket , meaning never toasted surly not double toasted and looked liked the used a whole can of cream cheese on it.i refuse to buy anything else it's a waste of money every time. The other times when they did get the order right I would have whatever flavor cream cheese on my bagel that the person before me had on their bagel on mine as well. If I ordered plan cream cheese I don't want to taste onion on mine just wipe off the knife. But I will say the staff there is really nice.
author: Ms F.

description:
Sorry highschool kids behind counter - yall were kinda whack...I just wanted to pick up a delightful toasted bagel for my co-worker, but no attention was paid to lil ol me.

After 3-4 mins i got some semblance of help, but then the bagel was over 2 dollars with cream cheese (maybe im just old school - its bread and cream cheese people!).  Lots of other good snack options on chesnut with 'cheerier' counter folk.  Though I can see how working at a bagel shop in the Marina might make a highschool kid bummer - but lets think positive people, discounts on SHMEAR!?  Sweet!!!
author: Melissa H.

description: Service is not the best, but this is the place to go if your looking for a snack in San Francisco. Bagels are $1 each. They are the best bagels I've ever had. They bake more bagels once every hour. Bagels are warm and crunchy on the outside, and chewy and warm on the inside. DELICIOUS.
author: Dan V.

description:
Noah's is A-OK!

I've been so addicted to their onion bagel toasted with cream cheese and a latte. Though I had their chicken panini for lunch and it just didn't taste right. I felt like i was eating nasty frozen chicken (which I probably was). It just seems a little juicy and slimy, now tell me that's not gross! And it was just too greasy. 

I would stick to breakfast but its a solid 3 star A-OK quick breakfast place.
author: Krystle M.

description:
I hate Noah's FUTON like Bagels.
but,
I like real Futon.
I like fluffy things.
I like bouncy things.
I like things like Japanese fresh made rice cake, Mochi.
We call "Mochi-mochi" for a full body curvy a bit chubby woman figure thing. ( Not moshi-moshi, that's "hello" for phone.)
Things like gnocchi, nice egg noodle, chow fun, to mantao. 
but,
Not Noah's bagel.
Too much air in it.
I end up inhale the air and speak like chick monks.
And it's so slow here.
Chick monks are working here, MuzaFXXXers!
But,
I'd like to eat my toasted bagel HOT.
FXXX YOU VERY MUCH, Dumb Ass!

Btw, Kleen said, 
"Um...."chick monks" ?? It's too funny to correct but I *think* you want
"chipmunks"..... I think. Are you smoking the pot? "

She is right, as always, CHIPMUNKS! I thought chick monks but I found this. That's why. 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mWAeqFQRXZk

Btw, i can eat 6 donuts without smoke pot.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Just take me to Noah's, gimme a cuppa and lox & bagel, and stay outta my way.  My mouth is gonna be happy.   I'm gonna be happy. 

Around the corner from Izzy's steaks & a block down from Cow Hollow Motor Inn in the Marina District.

Very convenient for me.

Oh yeah - they have a small patio out back.
author: Charlie G.

description:
You know how you wake up on a Sunday morning, feeling like garbage and in desperate need of a caffeine jolt and a carbo load so you can move your limbs as though they weren't stuck in molasses?

Yeah?  Well, so do the people who work at Noah's.  I stood at the register, cash in hand extended forward, waiting to pay for my simple order of a latte and a plain bagel with non-fat cream cheese.  My arm got tired from holding the money in mid-air for 15 minutes.  No joke.  I thought that the girl in line behind me was going to throw down with the cashier, who's back was turned to the verbal complaints (as well as my quickly cooling coffee beside her).  One man threw his order receipt in a crumpled ball and walked out.  I should have followed.

Don't bother with Noah's. With a wait like this, only the most flavorful bagel would satisfy the irritation.  Instead, you are left with a dry, boring bagel and a cold latte.
author: Teal C.

description:
.5 star please?   First off, they need to remove the "New York" from the name, this is about as far off from a new york bagel as you can get.   

8 people behind the counter have the combined IQ of a german shephard, its really sad.  They make McD's workers look like chemical engineers.   
After writing down your order (must be hard to remember bagel with cc), they some make the 1 minute toaster (should i say bagel warmer) take about 10 minutes.    Proceed to adding about 1 gram of cream cheese, barely enough to cover the bagel.   
Continue down the line where it might take another 10 minutes to add up.    
The rare times i have eaten here, I was borderline starving to death, yet it still tasted like crap.  That cant be good.  
Noah's- Do us all a favor and close down and stop dragging down the good name of NY bagels. (oh, how I miss you Essa bagel and H&H bagel.)
author: Dan G.

description:
As a native New Yorker I've been highly resistant to eating any other bagel than an H&H Bagels (the best bagel in the world) but finally, after 2 years of living here, finally broke down and tried Noah's. Not very surprising that I was let down. More air than bagel, Noah's just didn't deliver the goods. In addition, I have to say that their coffee was watery and just about the most tasteless coffee I've ever had.

For now, the House of Bagels will have to do.
author: Gabriel R.

description: A Noahs is a Noahs is a Noahs. There's not much to differentiate one location from the next. However, this location has super friendly cashiers/workers 99% of the time. They know the names of the regulars and always say nice things or manage some sort of positive small talk. I'm surprised by the bad reviews. The blonde middle aged woman that works in the mornings and weekends is especially nice!
author: Maria Y.

description:
The bagels are fine, but the service is bad.  As other yelpers have stated, they are slightly rude, but I don't care because I can and will be just as rude to them as they are to me. I had to pull the manager away from talking to a what looked like a friend at a table to help me this morning.  How bad is that!  God!  I am standing there waiting patiently for the manager to return to the counter to take my order.  She totally ignores me, so I go directly to her and TELL her to take my order.  I say two cheese bagels with cream cheese on the side for both.  I order it the same way everyday.  My buddy at work and I like to control how much cream cheese goes on our bagels.  When she rings me up, the amount is less than usual.  I look into the bag and realize she only gave me one bagel...that explains it.   I then tell her that I had ordered two.  She has the nerve to tell me I said one....with attitude.  I just gave attitude back to her and said No!  I ordered two...I said two...don't  argue with me...I know what I said! 

See, I too could be just as rude!  There's more where that comes from!
author: Ryan M.

description:
I have been to Noah's a couple times... it's a good place to grab a quick breakfeast. 

The bagel sandwiches are OK, nothing spectacular. I really like the fresh squeezed OJ. 

Sold Coffee selection.
author: Blake W.

description: Expect to wait in line.  The bagels are great but the staff is mediocre.  How hard is it to listen to the customers order and make what is asked for?  Apparently this is quite a challenge for those employed at this location.  However, taste trumps the consistent service failure so I will be back.
author: Freaky P.

description:
Noah's is my preferred bagel chain, and this location always has a constant in and outflow of Laurel Heights parents and whippersnappers on weekends. Their location in Potrero used to carry the magical bialy, my favorite, but this location never seems to have any. What's up with that, Noah?

For those who don't know what a bialy is, the main difference from a bagel as far as I know is that the former is baked while the latter is boiled. And instead of a hole in the middle it has a depressed area, which is typically filled with diced onions. Then you add the cream cheese!
author: Nish N.

description:
Ah inconsistency at its best...  from a chain "restaurant" you ask?  I don't get it either.  Sometimes the bagels are toasted for about 3 seconds or about 30.  sometimes the bagels are almost dry....  other times i find myself wiping half of the spread off onto my paper.  Sometimes they cut it into quarters, but most of the time not.  

If it wasn't so close to my house, i would never go here, unfortunately, it is all too convenient...  so suffer through it, i will.
author: Robert R.

description:
I actually love their coffee!  It's not dark like Starbucks. Very drinkable. 

One time I actually waited 45 minutes for a bagel at this location.  Not a great bagel place at all.  We need a New Yorker to move out here and open a real bagel joint - NY style.  For those of you who have never had a real NY bagel, don't think Noah's theme or bagels are real NY at all! Just good grab and run food!( oh except for the coffee!)
author: Robin S.

description: The bagels are good. The staff appears to want to kill themselves, or perhaps you, should you dare interrupt their conversation to order a bagel toasted with butter IN A BAGEL SHOP. Minus 3 stars for the asshole factor.
author: Mindy S.

description: This place sucks. What's better than stale bagels and assholes to serve them to you. Walk 1/2 a block to All Star Doughnuts where they are super friendly and remember your order and speak 5 languages and the bagels are fresh each day and cheap.
author: John R.

description:
I am not a bagel eater usually. The two bagels I ordered (to go), were hardly toasted and the spread was very uneven and sloppily put on both sides. 

But, I must say, that the service was incredibly friendly and fast, especially for a busy, rainy Sunday morning.
author: Laura D.

description: Toasted everything bagel with cream cheese: perfection.  That's what it all boils down to for me.  I also haven't experienced any of the difficulties people are mentioning regarding the staff, screwed up orders, etc.  They seem to have a very efficient system of taking your order and having it ready (and correct) by the time you get down to the cashier.  In addition to the top-notch bagels, they have an excellent southwest wrap with no extra charge for egg whites only.   Their coffee and fresh-squeezed orange juice are five-stars-worthy as well.  They have a few tables but not many, so you can't count on dining in, but you can count on delicious breakfast fare and beverages every time.
author: Stephanie S.

description: I keep going back only because it's a short walk from my house- but every time I leave, I'm left wondering why I keep going back. Like others have previously mentioned- more times than not, the staff looks miserable & are less than friendly. The bagels are good, but it annoys me how they never slice my bagel all the way in half & the way they only put cream cheese or butter on one side. Take 2 seconds and slap some on the other side too... geez.
author: Jenna R.

description:
Who the hell still eats bagels?

You're just asking for a mid-morning nap.  Two stars for good coffee.  Try the Chelsea - rich hazelnut heaven.
author: Isaac L.

description: I love Noahs... Bagels in general, really. This is probably my favorite Noahs in the city. Good people watching, the cream cheese is always slightly melted and the man behind the counter nicely never comments when I have gone three days in a row :)
author: Maddy D.

description:
I'm puzzled by the low stars here.  Here's my take:

Noah's coffee is the best, bagels are awesome, and you can connect to the Cow Hollow Inn's wi-fi if you sit in the back terrace.
author: pieter v.

description:
You can add me to the long list of dissatisfied customers as well.  I've been coming here for a little over a year (I know, much too long but it's convenient and easier some mornings than the Fillmore location).

My main complaint is that they NEVER TOAST THE BAGELS adequately.  My boyfriend and I discovered "double toasting" to compensate for this oversight but even now that just means you'll get a WARMED bagel.  Not toasty.  Not crunchy.  Not crispy.  On the rare occasions they do actually toast it, it seems that the toaster conveyor is still on super-sonic speed and they just crank up the heat.  The result is a burned outside and barely warm interior.  I'd be happy to wait the extra 2-3 minutes it would take to slow down the toaster conveyor and get a nice evenly browned bagel.  

I always double check with the girl (or guy) that hands me the finished product by asking "double toasted?"  They smile and dubiously answer "yes".  I'm sitting here right now with a horrid bagel - scorched black on the outside and not even warm inside.  How to do they manage to screw something up so badly?

Perhaps the worst part of this location (I would easily manage to overlook this if they properly toasted my bagel) is the horrible manager (or so I believe her to be so....).  She is rude and abrupt.  A real bitch for working in a job that demands mediocre customer service.  

I hope I never return.....
author: T R.

description: I used to love Noah's....and then I learned the Truth. High fructose corn syrup! Why, why, why?!
author: Adrienne C.

description:
The bagels ara good like in all the stores, but today (feb 14)  I was there  around 5:00 pm and the asian employee was so rude with us, me and my pregant wife. She didn't ask me if I want to toast my bagel. My wife used the bathroom and when she came back; she told that the bathroom smell very, very bad, she couldn't even use it. We told the asian girl about the bathroom and she say something about it, but we didn't understand, and she left the place.
Its very sad because I love the noah's Bagels they are my favorites, but thanks this women and never come back to that store. she was rude, unfriendly and hater.
author: Fabio G.

description:
As good as it gets! Indeed! 

Just want to give a 5 star review for Kayla and staff ( I think I got the name right) Ordered 6 doz sliced bagels for this morning plus spreads of course (preschool parents thingy) and it went as smoothly as it could go. For some reason in this economy customer service has tanked, on the phone and in person ...no one seems to give a crap any more...this was refreshing to experience and the bagels were just fine. I am an ex new yorker and a critic indeed, but these bagels were all gone at the end of the event. Thanks for the attention to detail.
author: Jessica K.

description: This place is clean and i always get my egg sandwich fast when the manager Christine there she's friendly and always smiling, laughing each time i go there.
author: Kay T.

description: I don't care much for the bagels at Noah's, and they sure as hell aren't New York style (this chain is called Einstein Bagels on the East Coast cuz you can't get away with that shit over there), but I'll be damned if this wasn't the friendliest, most have-a-nice-day-ist group of employees I've encountered in a long time.  I mean seriously, I was given positive reinforcement and asked if I had everything i needed like 5 or 6 times during my 5 minute purchasing experience.  Noah's - your bagels are hella edible and your staff is nice as all hell.
author: Oliver N.

description: Every time I come to this Noah's they always mess something about my order up and decide to not care at all about their mistakes. These people never get my order right and I really question NEVER coming back.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I'd give 0 stars if I could.  I never understood my coworkers complaints about this branch until now.  

I placed an order with Catering for a delivery, but I received a call the day before the event that it didn't go through.   So I called the Chestnut store in SF at 6:30 am the next morning to order the boxes to be prepared so that I could PICK IT UP in time for a meeting at 7:30 am.  The woman at Chestnut Street said she could not prepare the bagel boxes for me because the stores get too busy.  I'd need to buy their pre-made bagel boxes.  I wasn't happy, but what could I do.  I asked for one container of OJ.  She said she could not give me more than 1 cup,  because there were events in SF that weekend and they expected crowds.  She said I needed to order the 2 qts of OJ a few days earlier.  I told her about the mess that Catering had caused for me, and that I did order earlier, but she said no.  To save time, I requested to prepay for the order over the phone, but she refused because she expected crowds at any minute (this is before 7 am on a Sunday) and that it was against company policy.  When we drove by the store at 7:15 am, Noah's was empty.  

I felt like I was in the Twilight Zone. I've ordered and pre-payed for bagel boxes from this branch before with no problem.  I told her this and reminded her of the mess Catering had caused for me.  She wasn't interested and said if she found out who the employee was who let me prepay and preorder bagel boxes, she'd make sure they were reprimanded!   At this point I was exasperated/livid.  This woman didn't care about the customer and did not seem to have a concept of service. 
 
I ended up not purchasing anything from Noah's and went to Peet's Coffee across the street instead.   Their staff were incredibly professional.  My pre-ordered coffee tubs were waiting for me at the counter with the receipts attached.  Their staff even helped carry everything to the car.  Noah's needs to learn customer service skills from Peets.  I'll never order from them again for my events/meetings even though I've been a customer for 10+ years.   To add insult to injury, my credit card was charged for the order I never received.  I called to ask for a refund which they promised to make.  It's been 10 days, and I still have not received the refund.  What a nightmare.
author: DJ Y.

description: I recently moved to San Francisco and had a bagel at Noah's. I used to love Noahs years ago, but after living in NY for the past 8 years and having "real" bagels every day, I was pretty disappointed when I returned to Noahs. I don't think the bagels changed, I think I just found out what a real bagel should be. What I don't like about Noah's is that they are just too doughy and not crispy enough on the outer shell of the bagel. They're also just too big.They do have good cream cheese though.
author: Mary C.

description: I guess if you enjoy waiting, having rude staff mess your order up, then re-do it throwing you attitude, then this Noah's is all for you.  Wow what a terrible experience.
author: Mark K.

description: Ok. Good OJ. Does not taste fresh but a good option for a sandwich or breakfast sandwich. Service is good.
author: Alex S.

description: I love Noah's.  I love New York bagels. Noah's does not make real NY bagels.  I don't care.  Noah's bagels are yummy, cheesy toasted bread goodness.  They serve them with eggs if you'd like.  It's up to you. You can even have a bagel wrapped around a hot dog here.  How clever.  People who hate Noah's because they do not make real NY bagels need to learn to open their hearts to a wider variety of bagel options.  After all, when it comes down to it, they're all made of yeast, flour, and water.  And some other stuff.
author: Amanda B.

description:
'Tis gross in these parts. 

$8 is whack-a** for a turkey sandwich and Coke. 

Horrible service from dumbass, pimply counter-girl and the place feels dirty inside. One point for the patio in the back (not great, and it's near the bathroom..uhm. cabin thing--outhouse?), but it's better than eating inside.
