I shall not return.
author: Gym W.

description: Never order a "sandwitch" at Noahs.....bad, bad, bad,...soaked bread...long wait....just bad.
author: Kristina A.

description: I wasn't impressed with the service. The people that are working there are just smart alecky. These same people would be killed and eaten alive in new york. I would prefer a hardened chinese immigrant serving me my bagel.  The seats in the back are okay but kind of dirty and bathroom is close. There are not that many seats in the front. Bad Design
author: Jason W.

description: Food good, people nice, wait time is the only reason it's not 5 stars.  It's not terrible by any means, but sometimes it can be a bit long.
author: Greg S.

description: I live down the street and frequent this place often.  Their sandwiches are really good and it used to have outstanding service which wold explain the long but fast moving lines.  However, it has really gone downhill in the last month or so.  Two visits ago I ordered a hot sandwich that was never heated.  This last time I got a bagel and cream cheese but there was hardly any cream cheese on it.  If you pay nearly $5.00 for a cup of coffee, a bagel and cream cheese, shouldn't you get a fair amount of cream cheese?  Shouldn't it look remotely like the picture?  Both times I was shoved out the door as fast as they could get me out of there.  It looks to me like an outstanding manager of the place has moved on and now there are all new people working there that are still learning their jobs.  I get that  people do need time to learn their job but I'm just saying this place isn't the fabulous place it used to be.
author: Chris W.

description:
don't usually care for noah's bagels...............but the stars are for their new cookie "mudslide" -- its like a nice chewy brownie cookie, which i devoured in 3 bites & tastes like "more, more, more"  -- great chocolate fix for a hard day @ work.................

i also love their seasonal fall-time pumpkin bagel toasted with pumpkin cheesecake shmear(perfect as i totally want pumpkin everything in the fall)..............

i've been going there lately for pbj on toasted whole wheat sesame (you can't go wrong), when i don't bring lunch from home.  i'm cheap  when i'm eating lunch alone during my lunch break from work, so its cheap & does the bare necessity of giving me energy to make it thru the day..........
author: Cindi N.

description:
these bagels are fine.  but it's true that since my stint on the east coast i have yet to find a truly decent bagel.  

every time i travel back east i make a point to pick up the real deal - but if i have a craving for a sesame bagel with chives cream cheese this place is close and convenient...
author: Lauren V.

description: Actually Noah's isn't bad to hit up once in a while for a late lunch especially during the week - forget about going there on a weekend morning; you'll end up possibly waiting quite a while.  During the week, you can easily get a sandwich (and/or soup) in a few minutes and you're off!  My orders are generally fairly simple so any time I go in to get a bagel or anything else, it probably takes a lot less time than most people.
author: Venu B.

description: My usual is a blueberry bagel, toasted with butter.  I think Noah's blueberry bagels are quite good.  Fortunately, an order this simple is hard to screw up and as a result they hardly ever do screw it up (the rare error being barely any butter).  Noah's also makes a good tuna sandwich, which I prefer on an everything bagel.  I personally have never had a problem or issue with the staff at this location.
author: daniel g.

description:
this place is solid - esp when you wake up with no recollection of the prior night (or sometimes with a random chick that has a bunch of cash in her pocket for some reason and your ATM card) and need a quick place to get a filling meal - the egg mitts are pretty darn good - but they ask to specialize your order and never specialize them, which is usually funny bc i cant really walk straight and am more wondering if people are looking at me

jk - i like this place, the coffee, egg mitts, breakfast paninis and soups are all my favorites
author: AARISH P.

description: "I've tried to like this place and its other counterparts around the city but I just can't do it.  I basically only go b/c, like many places in SF, it's the only game in town and I have no choice.  It's terribly slow, they have no concept of how to toast a bagel and there's always 3 or 4 employees just standing around not doing anything even though there's a line out the door.  It's absurd.  If anyone knows of a better bagel spot (downtown and in the Marina) please help me!"
author: Ray G.

description: The one star is not for Noah's everywhere, but this particular Noah's. I love Noah's bagels and have been going there in each of the 3 different cities I've lived in the past 10 years. I normally like the Marina Noah's. This morning, however was different. I came in at 9am but it wasn't completely packed; ordered a large coffee only to find out that each of the 5 coffee containers was out of coffee. Ended up making a mix of everything as they didn't seem to be too concerned about refilling them. Whatever. Then I get my bagel, go home, open up the paper, and nearly 1/4 of it is burned to a crisp -- literally, it is black, and there is a whole burned through the top. Any normal food establishment would not serve a burned piece of food; but apparently they saw nothing wrong with this. I was too irritated to go back and demand a new one, because who knows what would go wrong then. Never had issues before. New management, maybe?
author: Stacey H.

description: I got a quick chicken bagel here today.  The bagel was really good, but I really appreciated that guy behind the counter who suggested I get *2*, since they're really small.  Well, the bagels were definitely small, and I guess I look like I eat a lot...
author: ann l.

description: the best coffee in the world!  the bagels aren't bad either...wink wink.  good quality for the money
author: Jennifer A.

description: Well, this location has been here for a long time now and they have definitely improved the experience.  When this location first opened, the lines were so long and it was disorganized.  Now that the novelty has worn off, the lines are a bit more manageable and they are a lot more organized.  The bagels are always fresh and they give you plenty of cream cheese or butter or whatever you order with your bagel.  The folks are nice.  Prices are reasonable.
author: Brian L.
